1.verse: Praise ye the LORD. O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

2.verse: Who can utter the mighty acts of the LORD? who can shew forth all his praise?

3.verse: Blessed are they that keep judgment, and he that doeth righteousness at all times.

4.verse: Remember me, O LORD, with the favour that thou bearest unto thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;

5.verse: That I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.

6.verse: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.

7.verse: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked him at the sea, even at the Red sea.

8.verse: Nevertheless he saved them for his name's sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.

9.verse: He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.

10.verse: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

11.verse: And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.

12.verse: Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.

13.verse: They soon forgat his works; they waited not for his counsel:

14.verse: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.

15.verse: And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.

16.verse: They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron the saint of the LORD.

17.verse: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.

18.verse: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.

19.verse: They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.

20.verse: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.

21.verse: They forgat God their saviour, which had done great things in Egypt;

22.verse: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, and terrible things by the Red sea.

23.verse: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.

24.verse: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:

25.verse: But murmured in their tents, and hearkened not unto the voice of the LORD.

26.verse: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:

27.verse: To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.

28.verse: They joined themselves also unto Baalpeor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

29.verse: Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.

30.verse: Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment: and so the plague was stayed.

31.verse: And that was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations for evermore.

32.verse: They angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:

33.verse: Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.

34.verse: They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the LORD commanded them:

35.verse: But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.

36.verse: And they served their idols: which were a snare unto them.

37.verse: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,

38.verse: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan: and the land was polluted with blood.

39.verse: Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.

40.verse: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.

41.verse: And he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.

42.verse: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.

43.verse: Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked him with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.

44.verse: Nevertheless he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:

45.verse: And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

46.verse: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.

47.verse: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.

48.verse: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the LORD.
